discourse_list.title: Is the June 18 Executive Proposal Controversial, or are people just lazy?

content.content: Sitting at 3.3k MKR right now, while the June 11th has 83.3k MKR. Are people actively choosing to forego voting for this one or do they not know it exists right now?
content.GPT-summary: The post is asking a question about the June 18 Executive Proposal and whether it is controversial or if people are simply not aware of it. The author is seeking feedback and opinions on why the proposal has only received 3.3k MKR compared to the June 11th proposal which has 83.3k MKR.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: If someone wanted to oppose an executive, they would probably stack it on the Dec 11th, 2020 executive. That’s been quietly building up to the point where more MKR will raise the requirements to pass an executive. Or at least, that’s where I’d be telling people to move their chess pieces. So I think it’s just that it’s a Monday after a 3-day weekend
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
